text:
Hey guys it's Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

I got so many requests from you guys to
make something Wonder Woman themed, and I

am super excited. In celebration of the
new movie coming out we are gonna be

making some themed treats today. We're
going to be making a dairy-free cookie

recipe because I've also been getting a
lot of requests from you guys to make a

dairy-free cookie, so today we're gonna
be making classic Wonder Woman themed

cookies that are dairy free. Let's get
started. The things you will need will be

three and a half cups of all-purpose
flour, one and a half cups of vegan

butter, one and a quarter cup of powdered
sugar, half a teaspoon of kosher salt, and

the juice and zest of one lemon, and to
cut out our cookies you'll need a plaque

shaped cookie cutter.
I chose one to give it that classic

look but you can pick whatever you'd
like. Now let's put it all together. The first

thing that we're gonna do is whisk our
salt into our flour. Next, mix our vegan

butter and sugar together until it's
very smooth. Now we're going to add the

zest and juice of one lemon. Take your
lemon and push it all the way down the

grate like you're grating cheese. You
want to get all of the yellow skin off

of the lemon. When you see the white stop.
Oh yeah! Now we need to get the juice

from this lemon. Just using my hand give it
a roll. Then, using a small sharp cutting

knife cut in half. I'm using a little
reamer, but you don't need to. This is

totally optional. Get all the juice out.
Easy peezie lemon squeezie. Mix on a medium speed. All of

our ingredients are ready. We have our
dry ingredients over here and our wet

ingredients. Pour all of the dry
ingredients into the wet. Mix together

till everything's well combined and
there's no more dry. The cookie dough is

ready it's smelling so good you guys.
Divide the dough in half. Shape it into a

disk with your hands and wrap it up
tight. We're going to be doing that for

both halves of our dough. Now we're gonna
pop our dough in the fridge to chill for

1 hour. Our dough has chilled and now it
is time to roll it out, so you're going

to take it
out of the wrap. I like to get going.Yes!

That was the best one in a long time.
Take a pinch of flour, sprinkle it on the

top of the surface we're working on. We're
going to roll it out about a quarter

inch thick. We've got our dough rolled
out, and now we're going to cut out our

cookies. Put some pressure, cut down, give
it a little jiggle, bring the cookie over

here to a baking sheet lined with a
piece of parchment paper. Our cookies are

almost ready to bake. I'm going to pop
these in the freezer for 10 minutes to

completely chill. This will help them
keep their shape while they're baking. Then,

I'm going to pop them in the oven at 325
degrees and bake them for about 10 to 12

minutes. While our cookies are baking
we're going to make some of our

decorations. In front of me I have got
the Wonder Woman logo template. I made

this in Photoshop. I'll put a link down
below if you want to download this

template. I'm gonna place my template
down, the wax paper over it, and then tape

down the corners. I'm going to be
outlining all of the Wonder Woman

logos and then filling them in with
royal icing, and I'm gonna start with my

black. I've put it into a plastic
baggie with a number one tip at the end

for a little bit more control, and I'm
just gonna trace everywhere that I see a

black line. You can also use toothpicks
for a little bit more detail. Once the

black outline has dried our yellow royal
icing, and fill in between all of the

black. Once the cookies have baked and had
plenty of time to cool now I'm going to

decorate the tops of them. Red, white, and
blue. Start with using the blue royal icing

I put into a plastic baggie with a
number 2 tip at the end for a little bit

more control, and I'm just going to
outline half of my cookie. Then I'm

taking the red royal icing, and I'm going
to pipe the outline on the bottom half

of a cookie. Flood our cookies with the
same colors, blue and red, starting with

blue. Flooding is just filling in, and we're
going to do the same thing with the red.

Our cookies are iced and our Wonder Woman
logos have dried. Now, I'm going to very

carefully use a little bit of white
royal icing right in the middle of the

cookie so that the Wonder Woman
logo will stick to the cookie. It's gonna act

as an edible glue. Boom! For the final
decoration step, we are going to be

piping on some patriotic stars. I've got
a number one tip at the end for a little

bit more control because it's a very
small design, and I'm just gonna pipe a

bunch of white stars up here at the top. Tada!
Here are the Wonder Woman cookies

that we made today. They look awesome.
A big thank you to you guys for

suggesting this idea, and I really hope
you enjoyed learning how to make a dairy

free sugar cookie recipe. I'll be posting
the recipe and a bunch of pictures on

Rosannapansino.com, Instagram,
Facebook, and Twitter, so you can check it

out there, and if you guys make these
cookies please take a picture and send

it to me. I love seeing your baking
creations. It just makes me happy. It

makes my day, and if you have any other
ideas for any other nerdy nummies please

let me know. Leave me a comment down
below, and I will do my best to make it

happen. Thanks again you guys. Bye-bye! Now
Wonder Woman gets to try a cookie. Mmm
I can taste the lemon!
